Viewing the View Comparison Menus

The View Comparison utility has its own set of menu options, which are described below. The Window and Help options for the View Comparison utility are identical to those that appear in the main window.

Project Menu

New

Start the New Project Wizard, and create a new project.

Open

Start the Open Project Wizard, and open an existing project.

Close

Close the current project.

Open Shortcut

Open a project view window or View Comparison window using a shortcut. The shortcut displays each view in the configuration it had at the time the shortcut was created.

Save Shortcut as

Create a new shortcut to the current project view or View Comparison window. The shortcut displays each view in the configuration it had at the time the shortcut was created.

Delete

Delete a project.

Recent Project

Reopen a recently opened shortcut to a project view or View Comparison window. The shortcut displays each view in the configuration it had at the time the shortcut was created.

Exit

Exit the application.

View Menu

Change Project/View...

Change the project and view displayed in either the source or the target pane.

Select View...

Change the selected view to another view from the same project.

Select Configuration...

Rollback the current configuration of the selected view based on a label or a date and time or return to the current configuration for that view.

New Folder...

Add a new folder to the source or target view.

Delete Folder...

Delete the folder selected from the source or target pane.

Folder Properties

Review the properties for the folder selected from the source or target pane.

Folder References

Review the references for the folder selected from the source or target pane.

Refresh

Refresh the contents of the source or target pane.

Find Differences...

Define and search for differences between the two views. You can search for any combination of the following:

  • Items that need to be merged (each view has a different revision).

  • Items that exist in only one view (the source or the target).

  • Items that exist in both views but are different and need to be merged.

  • Folders that exist only in one view.

Find Next Difference

Find the next difference.

Find Previous Difference

Find the previous difference.

Item Menu

Share Items

Share the selected item, so that it appears in both views. This option is enabled only when the item selected from the lower pane is in one view and not the other.

Delete Items

Delete the selected item. This option is enabled only when the item selected from the lower pane is in one view and not the other.

Compare Items...

Compare folder and item properties or compare text files using Visual Diff.

Merge Items

To Source...: Create new revisions in the source view via manual merges. You can merge folder and item properties or merge the contents of files. Text files may be combined with Visual Merge.

To Target...: Create new revisions in the target view via manual merges. You can merge folder and item properties or merge the contents of files. Text files may be combined with Visual Merge.

Auto-Merge Items

To Source...: Automatically create new revisions in the source view. The application informs you if conflicts exist.

To Target...: Automatically create new revisions in the target view. The application informs you if items have conflicts.

Reconcile

Source View: Follow these steps:

  • Share items from the target view to the source view.

  • Delete items from the source view.

  • Create new item revisions automatically in the source view from merged items. The application informs you if the merged items that have conflicts.

Target View:  Follow these steps:

  • Share items from the source view to the target view.

  • Delete items from the target view.

  • Create new item revisions automatically in the target view from merged items. The application informs you if the merged items have conflicts.

Source Item Properties

Review the properties for the revision of the selected item in the source view.

Target Item Properties

Review the properties for the revision of the selected item in the target view.

Item References...

Display the references for the item selected from the lower pane.

Display

All Items: Display all items in the lower pane, regardless of the view they are in.

All Items with Differences: Display all items in the lower pane, except those that are considered identical in both the source and target folders. If you are not tracking merges, these items are truly identical. If you are tracking merges, these items have not changed since the last recorded merge.

All Items Needing Merge: Display all items in the lower pane that can be merged to either the source or target views. These items exist in both views, but are not considered identical.

Source Items Needing Merge: Display all items in the lower pane that can be merged to the source view. These items exist in both views, but are not identical. If you are tracking merges, the item in the target view has changed since the last recorded merge.

Target Items Needing Merge: Display all items in the lower pane that can be merged to the target view. These items exist in both views, but are not identical. If you are tracking merges, the item in the source view has changed since the last recorded merge.

All Items in Both Views: Display items in the lower pane that exist in both the source and the target views. You may want to compare or merge them.

All Items Not in Both Views: Display items in the lower pane that exist in only one view (the source or the target). These items are not in both views. You may want to share them or delete them.

Items Only in Source View: Display items in the lower pane that are only in the source view. You may want to share them or delete them.

Items Only in Target View: Display items in the lower pane that are only in the target view. You may want to share or delete them.

Use Merge Tracking for Merge Resolution: Select this option to track merges. When you track merges, corresponding items are considered identical if neither of them has changed since the last recorded merge. If it is selected, a check mark appears in front of the menu item. To stop tracking merges, select the option again, and the check mark will disappear.

Select

All Items: Select all items displayed in the lower pane.

All Items with Differences: Select all items displayed in the lower pane,  except those that are considered identical in both the source and target folders. If you are not tracking merges, these items are truly identical. If you are tracking merges, these items have not changed since the last recorded merge.

All Items Needing Merge: Select all items displayed in the lower pane that need to be merged (that is, items that exist in both views, but differ).

Source Items Needing Merge: Select all items displayed in the lower pane that can be merged to the source view. These items exist in both views, but are not identical. If you are tracking merges, the item in the target has changed since the last recorded merge.

Target Items Needing Merge: Select all items displayed in the lower pane that can be merged to the target view. These items exist in both views, but are not identical. If you are tracking merges, the item in the source view has changed since the last recorded merge.

All Items in Both Views: Select all items displayed in the lower pane that exist in both views. You may want to compare or merge them.

All Items Not in Both Views: Select all items displayed in the lower pane that exist in only  one view (the source or the target). You may want to share or delete them.

Items Only in Source View: Select all items displayed in the lower pane that are only in the source view. You may want to share or delete them.

Items Only in Target View: Select all items displayed in the lower pane that are only in the target view. You may want to share or delete them.

Refresh

Refresh all items in the lower pane (the item pane).

Tools Menu

Personal options

Set personal options for your Workspace, StarTeamMPX, and the File, Change Request, Requirement, Task, and Topic components. Each of these items has a tab that presents a variety of choices. See the Setting Personal Options section of the Help system for additional details.

StarTeam Log

Display the latest information from the Starteam client log, primarily for diagnostic purposes. The log can display error messages that occur during use of the application, summaries of each operation performed, details about each operation performed, and StarTeamMPX events.
